title: ES6 - Reuse JavaScript Code Using import
content: import allows you to choose which parts of a file or module to load. In the previos lesson, the example exported add from the math_functions.js file. Here how you can import it to use in other file:

Here, import will find add in math_functions.js, import just that function for you to use, and ignore the rest. The ./ tells the import to look for the math_functions.js file in the same folder of the current file. The relative file path (./) and file extensions (.js) are required when using import in this way.
